page.title: 12DENTON ... the past.
page.content: The stream which used to flow through the village has now been culvetted. However in the past there was intense{rivalry}between those living on opposite sides. Stepping stones had to be negotiated to cross from one side to the other and it would not be uncommon to see grown men {brawling on either bank. At one time the village had its own blacksmith and baker plus a few shoe makers. One story equally rooted in the past concerns a man caught in the {Red Lion pub during a storm.}Fearing perhaps the worst if he arrived home late, he borrowed a barrel and floated down the main street. Opposite the Red Lion a wide archway bears testament to an old coaching Inn. Later it was used as a{bakehouse; well attended by men on Sundays who enjoyed a pint as lunch cooked.
